intro: Wardaster lanuginosus, commonly known as the woolly star, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its soft, hairy stems and leaves, which give it a velvety appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in a star-like pattern, and bloom during the summer months. Wardaster lanuginosus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
